metadata.name: Usage Of Web Request Commands And Cmdlets - ScriptBlock
metadata.comment: Detects the use of various web request commands with commandline tools and Windows PowerShell cmdlets (including aliases) via PowerShell scriptblock logs

batch.sql: SELECT * FROM script_activity WHERE time BETWEEN CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() - INTERVAL 24 HOUR AND CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() AND (lower(activity_id) = lower('1') AND (contains(lower(script.script_content.value), lower('[system.net.webrequest]::create')) OR contains(lower(script.script_content.value), lower('curl ')) OR contains(lower(script.script_content.value), lower('invoke-restmethod')) OR contains(lower(script.script_content.value), lower('invoke-webrequest')) OR contains(lower(script.script_content.value), lower('iwr ')) OR contains(lower(script.script_content.value), lower('net.webclient')) OR contains(lower(script.script_content.value), lower('resume-bitstransfer')) OR contains(lower(script.script_content.value), lower('start-bitstransfer')) OR contains(lower(script.script_content.value), lower('wget ')) OR contains(lower(script.script_content.value), lower('winhttp.winhttprequest'))) AND NOT startswith(lower(script.file.path), lower('c:\\packages\\plugins\\microsoft.guestconfiguration.configurationforwindows\\')))

output.summary: Detects the use of various web request commands with commandline tools and Windows PowerShell cmdlets (including aliases) via PowerShell scriptblock logs

metadata.objective: False positive: Use of Get-Command and Get-Help modules to reference Invoke-WebRequest and Start-BitsTransfer. References: https://4sysops.com/archives/use-powershell-to-download-a-file-with-http-https-and-ftp/, https://blog.jourdant.me/post/3-ways-to-download-files-with-powershell
